Delhi, India - Climate Chart
More Related Articles on PlanetWare.com
 Other highlights include several unique items, such as a collection of saloon cars belonging to the country's once powerful Maharajas, including the teak carriage of the Maharaja of Mysore, covered with ivory; the cabin of the Prince of Wales from 1876; and the carriage in which the ashes of Gandhi were carried after his assassination in 1948. Built in the mid-16th century by Haji Begum as a memorial to her husband by Humayun's senior widow, the tomb is surrounded by lush formal gardens and other tombs including Humayun's barber and the Tomb of Isa Khan (the architect of the Taj Mahal), a fine example of Lodi architecture and octagonal in shape.
 The former, inaugurated by the British in 1931 to serve as the imperial capital, is the nation's modern capital and seat of government, while Old Delhi is considered by many as the symbolic heart of the greater metropolitan area.
 The Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum
Another important politician-related attraction is the Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum, housed in the former residence of this much-revered woman (Indira was the daughter of India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, and although a friend of Mahatma Gandhi, was unrelated).

activity_research_results.title: Top things to do in Delhi during summer - Lonely Planet - Lonely Planet
activity_research_results.content: Delhi's history, art, culture, and quirks are proudly displayed in its countless museums and art spaces, and most are blissfully air-conditioned. The National Museum is a remarkable repository of India's past history, with cool, airy galleries full of sculptures, paintings and treasures where visitors can marvel for hours on end.

activity_research_results.title: THE 10 BEST Museums in New Delhi (Updated 2024) - Tripadvisor
activity_research_results.content: If you are looking for the best museums in New Delhi, India, you can find them on Tripadvisor. Browse through the reviews and photos of the top-rated museums in the city, such as the National Museum, the Gandhi Smriti, and the Crafts Museum. Discover the rich history, culture, and art of New Delhi with Tripadvisor.

activity_research_results.title: 20 Must-Visit Parks in Delhi Perfect for a Day Out (2024) - Holidify
activity_research_results.content: Here is the list of 20 Parks in Delhi for a Perfect Day-out. 1. Lodhi Garden, Delhi. 3.8 /5 View 10+ photos. Located near the Safdarjung tomb and Khan Market of Delhi, the Lodhi Garden is a luscious garden that houses the tombs of Sayyid ruler Mohammed Shah and Lodhi king Sikandar Lodhi. activity_recommendations.title: Visit the National Museum
activity_recommendations.description: The National Museum is a remarkable repository of India's past, featuring galleries filled with sculptures, paintings, and treasures.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: With a medium budget and an interest in museums, visiting the National Museum will give you a deep and air-conditioned break from the summer heat while exploring India's rich history.

activity_recommendations.title: Discover Gandhi Smriti
activity_recommendations.description: Gandhi Smriti is a museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, where he spent the last 144 days of his life. Experience his journey and impactful legacy.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: Given your interest in museums, Gandhi Smriti offers an intimate glimpse into the life of one of India's most significant historical figures.

activity_recommendations.title: Explore Lodhi Garden
activity_recommendations.description: Lodhi Garden is a luscious park housing the tombs of Sayyid ruler Mohammed Shah and Lodhi king Sikandar Lodhi, set against beautiful landscapes.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: This park provides a combination of history and natural beauty, perfect for a relaxing day out during the summer.

activity_recommendations.title: Stroll through Humayun's Tomb Gardens
activity_recommendations.description: Humayun's Tomb is a magnificent example of Mughal architecture with surrounding lush, formal gardens, making it a serene spot to visit.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: For a medium-budget traveler interested in historical sites and green spaces, this UNESCO World Heritage site is a must-see.

activity_recommendations.title: Shop at Chandni Chowk
activity_recommendations.description: Chandni Chowk is one of the oldest and busiest markets in Old Delhi, offering a variety of goods from spices to jewelry.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: This market is perfect for experiencing the vibrant shopping culture of Delhi while staying within a medium budget.

activity_recommendations.title: Explore Dilli Haat
activity_recommendations.description: Dilli Haat is an open-air market showcasing Indian crafts, handlooms, and food, providing a unique shopping experience.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: Your interest in shopping aligns perfectly with this market known for its affordable and quality handicrafts.

activity_recommendations.title: Relax in Nehru Park
activity_recommendations.description: Nehru Park is a large, beautifully landscaped park in Delhi, perfect for a peaceful day out with family or friends.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: This park offers a tranquil refuge from the bustling city and is ideal for a relaxing summer day.

activity_recommendations.title: Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum
activity_recommendations.description: Housed in the former residence of Indira Gandhi, this museum offers a unique insight into her life and times.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: Since you're interested in museums and historical sites, the Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum offers a personal look into one of India's significant leaders.

activity_recommendations.title: Visit the Crafts Museum
activity_recommendations.description: The Crafts Museum showcases traditional Indian crafts and textiles in an open-air setting.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: This museum aligns with your interest in both museums and shopping, offering an educational yet hands-on experience.

activity_recommendations.title: Qutub Minar
activity_recommendations.description: Qutub Minar is a towering example of early Indo-Islamic architecture standing at 73 meters high.
activity_recommendations.reasoning: As one of Delhi's top attractions, Qutub Minar provides a combination of historical interest and architectural grandeur, fitting your preferences perfectly.
